title: 10 Ways To Get Moving When You Don't Feel Like It
summary: If you’re not feeling the workout on any given day, try to go with the flow. Reward yourself with a special snack or bubble bath afterward. Find a friend or group to work out with you to help you stay motivated. Use apps and fitness trackers to keep you on track and set new goals for yourself each day. Take a break and shake it off, even if you're feeling discouraged or discouraged, it can be helpful to do deep breathing exercises or take a break from your workout.

Many of us make the common resolution to exercise more. However, that can be easier said than done for some people. If you don\u2019t feel like working out one day, it doesn\u2019t mean you stop going to the gym or just give up entirely. It means you have to come up with creative ways to stay motivated and get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it.
Exercising is not always fun, but we need it to remain healthy and fit. While some people love sweating in their favorite gym class, others avoid workouts because they know how much they hate them. While exercise can be difficult at times, there are lots of different ways you can make moving more fun so that it becomes second nature and something you no longer dread.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Don\u2019t force yourself to do something that you\u2019re not enjoying or that you\u2019re not good at just because you feel like you should. If you\u2019re trying and failing to do complicated moves that you\u2019re not good at, you\u2019ll likely end up getting frustrated and end up stopping your workout altogether.

If you\u2019re not feeling the workout, try a few of these tips to get yourself going again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Reward Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`When you do something you don\u2019t like, such as going to the gym, it can be helpful to give yourself a reward afterward. This can be anything from a special snack, to a bubble bath, or even just a few minutes of alone time. Whatever you reward yourself with, you should only do it after completing the task, so that it is associated with that.
If you\u2019re someone who is trying to lose weight, you might not want to reward yourself with a treat like ice cream or a donut. Try to go for something a bit healthier, like a smoothie or a piece of fruit.`),mdx("h2",null,"Find A Friend Or Join A Group"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re not enjoying your workout, try finding a friend to work out with you. Working out with a friend can be a great way to help you get motivated, stay focused, and push yourself further than you would on your own.
Find someone who is at a similar fitness level to work out with you. You don\u2019t want to work out with someone who is way more fit than you, because you might not be able to keep up, and you won\u2019t get anything out of it. However, you also don\u2019t want to work out with someone who isn\u2019t at a similar fitness level as you. This can be discouraging, and you might end up holding each other back.`),mdx("h2",null,"Utilize Apps And Trackers"),mdx("p",null,"If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym and prefer to workout at home, try using an app or a fitness tracker to keep you on track. Fitness trackers such as Fitbit are great for keeping track of your progress, as well as setting new goals and keeping you on track. Working out can be monotonous, so having something to keep you entertained and focused on can help you stay on task."),mdx("p",null,"If you are not working out at home, but prefer to go to the gym, try getting to the gym earlier in the day. This will help you avoid crowds and long lines, as well as having the gym all to yourself to work out."),mdx("h2",null,"Hit The Shower"),mdx("p",null,"If you aren\u2019t feeling motivated to workout at all, try getting into the shower earlier in the day. Exercising in the shower can be a great way to get your blood flowing, warm up your muscles, and get your heart rate up without even realizing it. If you do want to try exercising in the shower, make sure you don\u2019t get the water too hot, and make sure you dry off before heading back into your room."),mdx("p",null,"You can try doing some basic exercises, including lunges and squats, as well as shoulder presses, chest presses, and crunches. You can even try doing some yoga poses in the shower."),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break And Shake It Off"),mdx("p",null,`Sometimes, you just have to shake things off, even if you\u2019re feeling super discouraged. It\u2019s not uncommon to get frustrated during a workout. If something doesn\u2019t go as planned, or you don\u2019t feel like you\u2019re making progress, it\u2019s okay to feel a bit defeated.
When you feel defeated, it can be helpful to take a short break from your workout and shake it off. Walk around the gym, or take a quick break outside. Doing some deep breathing exercises or positive affirmations can be helpful. You can try saying things such as, \u201CI am strong,\u201D or \u201CI can do this,\u201D to help you get back on track when you feel discouraged.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Be Hard On Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`Exercising should be something you enjoy, not something that you dread, so try to not be so hard on yourself. If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, or you\u2019re just not finding the right workout for you, don\u2019t feel bad about changing things up.
If you\u2019re not enjoying the workout you\u2019re doing, it can be helpful to challenge yourself by pushing yourself a little harder. If you\u2019re not pushing yourself hard enough, it can be easy to get bored and lose interest in your workout. Throwing in some harder moves or increasing the intensity of your workout can help prevent this.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, try a new one, or even a new instructor. Not only can this help you stay motivated, but it can also help you mix things up and prevent boredom from setting in."),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"When you don\u2019t feel like going to the gym or working out, it can be easy to make an excuse as to why you can\u2019t. However, there are lots of ways to get yourself motivated and moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, even just for 10 minutes. If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym, find an alternative workout like yoga or hiking. There are lots of ways to get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, you just have to find what works best for you."),mdx("p",null,"The most important thing to remember is that when you don\u2019t feel like moving, you have to make yourself do it. relatedArticles.title: How to Get through the Work Day When You're Tired
relatedArticles.summary: These tips will help you stay alert and energized during your work day. Eating a small, but healthy meal before work is the best way to stay well-hydrated throughout the day. Taking a break during the day is another great way to keep you alert and focused. These tips and tricks can help you combat laziness and stay focused and motivated throughout the work day, no matter how early your shift starts or when you’re feeling fatigued, you can relax and enjoy your day with confidence.

It\u2019s not uncommon for employees to feel exhausted and unmotivated during the work day. Whether you have a long commute, stressful workload or unforgiving managers, being tired at your job is something that many workers deal with on a daily basis.
Unsurprisingly, research shows that when you\u2019re tired at work it has a negative effect on your efficiency and performance. It also makes you more prone to making mistakes and forgetting things.
Fortunately, there are ways to help manage these struggles and get through your work day when you\u2019re tired. Here are some helpful tips that can make all the difference:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Eat Healthy When You're Short on Time
relatedArticles.summary: Many people assume that leftovers are unhealthy, but that’s not the case if you make smart choices. Rotating your vegetables will help you avoid falling into a pattern where you’re only eating one or two types of vegetables every week. Eating smaller meals throughout the day has been shown to increase feelings of fullness and prevent overeating at meals. Eating beans and Lentils are two of the healthiest protein sources you can eat, and you can use them to replace meat in tacos and burritos.

relatedArticles.title: The Health Benefits of Walking - And How to Get Started
relatedArticles.summary: If you have to travel to work every day, you might be able to get a bit more out of your commute. Plan your route to work or home so that it passes by a walking trail or a park. You can also try walking up stairs or taking the stairs instead of the elevator or the escalator when you can. If you can, try to walk with someone who can keep you company and help you stay focused on the walk, rather than what you’re eating. Keep a supply of healthy snacks on hand to keep you energized.

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Yourself When You Have a Busy Schedule
relatedArticles.summary: You can’t expect to suddenly be able to make time for yourself when you feel like you have no time at all. Make time for your social and emotional needs but if you aren't taking care of your physical needs, you will eventually feel burnt out. If you have a creative hobby, you can actually use that to help make money by scheduling it in your calendar. Make sure that you choose friends who are positive and uplifting. You want friends who will just drag you down and make you feel bad about yourself. If you like to start their day with meditation or journaling, you should also make.

relatedArticles.title: How to Cook Healthier Meals at Home
relatedArticles.summary: Plan your healthy meals for the week, and use this to guide your menu planning. Planning your meals also makes it easier to avoid unhealthy impulsive purchases and resist the urge to order takeout. Prepping your ingredients in advance is a great way to save time and money. Add healthy fats to your diet, such as avocados, nuts, seeds, and olive oil, to boost your health. Try to incorporate leafy greens, bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, tomatoes, and more vegetables into your diet.

relatedArticles.title: The Best Healthy Snacks to Keep You Going
relatedArticles.summary: KIND bars are made with whole grains, nuts, fruits, and spices. Dark cocoa is great for boosting mood and energy, and nuts and sea salt have nutrients that help to boost energy. Bananas are also great for the brain and help to improve focus, making them a great snack to keep you going throughout the day. Beans and legumes are one of the best sources of fiber that you can eat, and they’re also high in protein. Greek yogurt is a great option for snacking on the go, and it’s also good for the bones.

relatedArticles.title: How to Get over a Break-Up
relatedArticles.summary: Exercising is one of the best things you can do for yourself when you're going through a break-up. Indulging in your favourite TV show or movie can be a great way to get over your current emotions. Don’t let yourself fall into the temptation of stalking and haunting your ex because it’s only going to hurt you more in the long run. Write in a journal or diary to help you get to a place of peace after a breakup and remember that you are always in control of yourself.

relatedArticles.title: The Best Healthy Cooking Tips for Beginners
relatedArticles.summary: Read the recipe before you start cooking to get an idea of what ingredients are needed, how many servings are recommended, and the time needed to cook the meal. Planning your meals for the week will help you prepare for the rest of the week. The oven may seem like it’s only good for baking cookies and roasting a chicken, but it's actually an essential kitchen appliance for healthy cooking. Adding healthy foods to your cooking is an easy way to make sure that you’re eating well without having to completely change your diet.

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating a Habit
relatedArticles.summary: Eating well doesn’t have to be hard or feel like a chore, it can be something you enjoy and look forward to. Try a new food at least once a week and make food more interesting and enjoyable. Eating with others can also help you make better choices, as you’re more likely to choose a salad over a carb-heavy side when others are watching. Set an intention before each meal can help you focus on what you're eating. Reward yourself for sticking to your diet.

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Snacks More Exciting
relatedArticles.summary: There’s no easy fix for changing eating habits for the long run, but you can speed up the process by making healthy snacks more exciting for your child in ways that are both fun and approachable. Show your child why you eat the way you do and why you want to be healthy. Rotate the healthy snacks with the unhealthy ones so they don't feel like they’re missing out or getting forced to eat something they don’t like. Let them help you make healthy snacks in the kitchen and let them help pick out what you want.
